intro: Canavalia reflexa, commonly known as the everlasting pea, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Canavalia reflexa is a perennial shrub that can grow up to 2 meters tall, with hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
